verbose_text: In subsequently analyzed serum ACPA levels from 134 seropositive RA women previously diagnosed with subclinical atherosclerosis, levels of anti-citrullinated fibrinogen (p < 0.001) and anti-citrullinated vimentin (p = 0.034), were associated with greater subclinical atherosclerosis as measured by increases in aortic calcium score; an association not seen with conventional anti-CCP testing [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: levels of anti-citrullinated fibrinogen (p < 0.001) and anti-citrullinated vimentin
